kihkd5d3Text:
Brintellix® delivers effective and sustained relief
from symptoms of MDD*1-3
kihkd5d5Text:
Brintellix® significantly improved depressive symptoms with a similar
effect size vs. placebo as venlafaxine*2
kihkd5d6Text: Change in MADRS total score2
kihkd5d8Text: Treatment week
Brintellix_244994b318:
Katona C et al. Int Clin Pyschopharmacol 2012;27:215-223.
Alvarez E et al. Int J Neuropsychopharmacol 2012;15:589-600.
Vieta E et al. Eur Neuropsychopharmacol 2017;27:877-884.
Brintellix_241f348ac7:
*As assessed by MADRS at Week 6.
**p<0.05; ***p<0.01; †p<0.001 vs. placebo. In a randomised, double-blind placebo-controlled, active-referenced study in adult patients with
severe MDD, as defined by a MADRS total score of ≥30.
Brintellix® was significantly superior to placebo in change from baseline in MADRS total scores (primary efficacy endpoint) at Week 6 (LOCF).
The statistical model was an analysis of covariance (ANCOVA). The primary efficacy analysis, evaluated using MADRS, was repeated on
observed case data using both ANCOVA and MMRM. Brintellix® (5 mg or 10 mg) and venlafaxine (225 mg) were all significantly superior to
placebo as assessed by MADRS at Week 6. Venlafaxine was included as active reference for study validation, not for comparison of effect size.
‡Brintellix® does not exhibit many of the side effects typical of SSRIs and SNRIs including sexual dysfunction and weight gain. 5-8 Side effects
associated with Brintellix® were compared with those of the SSRIs escitalopram and paroxetine and with those of the SNRI venlafaxine. For
the 20 mg/day dose, an increase in treatment-emergent sexual dysfunction was seen compared to placebo. Please refer to the full Summary
of Product Characteristics or Prescribing Information for further information on safety and tolerability.
LOCF, last observation carried forward; MADRS, Montgomery-Åsberg depression rating scale; MMRM, mixed model for repeated
measurements.
